def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift > len(x):
        return x[::-1]
    else:
        return x[:shift] + x[shift:]

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift > len(x):
        return x[::-1]
    else:
        return x + shift

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift < 0:
        shift = -shift
    if shift > len(x):
        shift = len(x) - shift
    return x[:-shift] + "..." + x[shift:]

    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift > len(x):
        return x[::-1]
    return x + shift

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift > len(x):
        return x[::-1]
    else:
        return x[::shift] + shift * '.' + x[::shift]

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift == 0:
        return x
    if shift < 0:
        return x[::-1]
    return x + shift * (x[-1] - x[0]) + x[0]

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift == 0:
        return x
    else:
        return x[::-1] + shift

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift > len(x):
        return x[::-1]
    return x[:shift] + x[shift:]

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift < 0:
        shift = -shift
    if shift == 0:
        return ""
    if shift == 1:
        return x
    return x + str(x % shift)[::-1]

    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift > len(x):
        return x[::-1]
    else:
        return x[::-(shift - len(x))]

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift > len(x):
        return x[::-1]
    return x + shift

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift < 0:
        shift = -shift
        x = -x
    else:
        shift = shift % 10
        x = x * 10 + shift
    return str(x)

    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift

    if shift > len(x):

def circular_shift(x, shift):
    """Circular shift the digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
    and return the result as a string.
    If shift > number of digits, return digits reversed.
    >>> circular_shift(12, 1)
    "21"
    >>> circular_shift(12, 2)
    "12"
    """
    if shift < 0:
        shift = -shift
    if shift > len(x):
        shift = len(x) - shift
    return x[:-shift] + "..." + x[shift:]
